org.jetel.component

Class LookupTableReaderWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.graph.GraphElement
      • org.jetel.graph.Node
        • org.jetel.component.LookupTableReaderWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, IGraphElement, CloverWorkerListener

    public class LookupTableReaderWriter
extends Node

    LookupTableReaderWriter Component

    Depending on ports connected (if there is any output port read mode is turned on) records are read from lookup table or put to it.
    Component:

    Name:

    		LookupTableReaderWriter

    Category:

    Description:

    Inputs:

    		[0] - input records

    Outputs:

    		[0] - records from lookup table

    Comment:


    XML attributes:
    type"LOOKUP_TABLE_READER_WRITER"
    idcomponent identification
    lookupTable name of lookup table for reading or writing records
    freeLookupTableoptionaltrue/false default: FALSE idicates if close lookup table after finishing execute() method. All records, which are stored only in memory will be lost

    Example:

     <Node id="READ" type="LOOKUP_TABLE_READER_WRITER">
 <attr name="lookupTable">LookupTable1</attr>
 </Node>
    Since:
    Dec 11, 2006

        public ConfigurationStatus checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Checks the configuration of this graph element. This method should verify that all required parameters are set and that the element can be used. This method might be called before graph execution, in such case it will be called before the IGraphElement.init() method. It is not guaranteed that this method will ever be called, but also this method may be called repeatedly. All resources allocated in this method should be freed in this method too.
